summary: This document is an FBI 302 form summarizing a May 20, 2021, video teleconference (VTC) interview with a law enforcement officer (referred to as 'U'). The officer recounts their involvement in a 2005 investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, including a prior theft investigation at Epstein's home and the execution of a search warrant on October 20, 2005. The officer describes the search process, their impression that Epstein had been tipped off, and their later role in transferring evidence to the FBI.

persons.name: Sami
persons.context: Participated in the VTC interview as an AUSA.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Reported a burglary at his home between 2003-2005 where $12,000 was stolen. His residence was searched on October 20, 2005, pursuant to a warrant. The officer saw photos of him with the Pope and Fidel Castro in his home.

connections.description: U investigated a burglary at Epstein's home and later participated in the 2005 search warrant execution of Epstein's residence.
AUSA Sami conducted the VTC interview with officer U regarding the 2005 Epstein investigation.

events.title: Burglary at Epstein's Home
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein reported a burglary at his home early one morning, stating about $12,000 was stolen from a briefcase in his ground floor office. The investigation pointed to a former butler/valet. Officer U was called to investigate but was told to confine the investigation to the specific area where the money was taken.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Residence
events.description: Law enforcement, including officer U, executed a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence. The officer had a sense the place had been 'really cleaned' and that Epstein may have been tipped off. The search was video recorded, evidence was photographed and logged, and concluded around 3 PM.

events.title: VTC Interview with Officer U
events.description: A video teleconference interview was conducted with officer U by AUSAs, including Sami, to discuss U's involvement in the 2005 Epstein investigation.

locations: Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence (the house searched on October 20, 2005)
keyFacts: Officer U investigated a theft at Jeffrey Epstein's home between 2003-2005, where $12,000 was stolen, allegedly by a former butler/valet.
During the 2005 theft investigation, U entered Epstein's home and saw photographs of Epstein with the Pope and with Fidel Castro.
During the October 20, 2005, search of Epstein's home, officer U had a sense the place had been 'really cleaned' and that Epstein may have been tipped off about the search.
Officer U's later role was to transfer all Palm Beach Police Department evidence from the 2005 Epstein investigation to the FBI.
The document references that a clip of the video from the 2005 search was included in episode three of the Netflix series 'Filthy Rich.'
